page.title: 10 Friars Court Farm
page.content: This is a mixed farm of 550 acres to the south of Clanfield,the River Thames forms the farm's southern boundary. The imposing farmhouse has a moat on two sides and lies on the site of a building of the Knights Hospitallers. The milking shed has recently been modernised and has herringbone shaped milking stalls.The corn store can hold 650 tons, has a dryer, and a cleaner to remove weeds from corn sold for seed. As far as is known,this year,1985 the farmer was the first in England to install a solar powered system for grain drying. He is still experimenting but already finds it more efficient than traditional methods. To save both time and energy (fuel), this year the farmer installed a C.B. system to communicate between the farm office and the workers in the fields.
